```{r 2_a }
#create a data set mean=0, sigma=0.2
dl1 = rnorm(10000,mean = 0 , sd = 0.2)
ggplot(data.frame(dl1), aes(x = dl1)) + geom_histogram(fill = "skyblue", color = "black")+xlim(-5, 5)

```
```{r 2_b }
#create a data set mean=0, sigma=0.2
dl1 = rnorm(10000,mean = 0 , sd = 0.5)
ggplot(data.frame(dl1), aes(x = dl1)) + geom_histogram(fill = "skyblue", color = "black")+xlim(-5, 5)
```


The heights of the bars on the y-axis decrease, indicating that the frequency within certain intervals is lower. On the x-axis, we observe that the range of the distribution is wider, meaning that the data are more diverse and spread over a larger area.


```{r 3_a}
dat=data.frame(cond = factor(rep(c("A","B"), each=200)),rating = c(rnorm(200),rnorm(200, mean=.8)))
```

```{r 3_b}
# Overlaid histograms
ggplot(dat, aes(x=rating, fill=cond)) + geom_histogram(binwidth=.5, alpha=.5, position="identity")

```


```{r 3_c}
# Interleaved histograms
ggplot(dat, aes(x=rating, fill=cond)) + geom_histogram(binwidth=.5, position="dodge")


```

```{r 3_d}
# Density plots
ggplot(dat, aes(x=rating, colour=cond)) + geom_density()

```

```{r 3_e}
# Density plots with semitransparent fill
ggplot(dat, aes(x=rating, fill=cond)) + geom_density(alpha=.3)


```

```{r 3_f_Read_Data}
# put data to diabetes variable 
diabetes = read.csv("diabetes_train.csv")

```

```{r 3_f_Overlaid_histograms}
# Overlaid histograms
ggplot(diabetes, aes(x = mass, fill = class)) + geom_histogram(binwidth=.5, alpha=.5, position="identity")

```

```{r 3_f_Interleaved_histograms}
# Interleaved histograms
ggplot(diabetes, aes(x=mass, fill=class)) + geom_histogram(binwidth=.5, position="dodge")

```

```{r 3_f_Density_plots}
# Density plots
ggplot(diabetes, aes(x=mass, colour=class)) + geom_density()

```

```{r 3_f_Density_plots2}
# Density plots with semitransparent fill
ggplot(diabetes, aes(x=mass, fill=class)) + geom_density(alpha=.3)

```

```{r 4_Read_file}
passengers = read.csv("titanic.csv")
head(passengers)

```

```{r 4_a}
passengers %>% drop_na() %>% summary()
#this code deletes empty rows from passenger data set and gets summary



```

```{r 4_b}
passengers %>% filter(Sex == "male")
#this filters data and get only male passengers

```


```{r 4_c}
passengers %>% arrange(desc(Fare))
#this order list according to fare from bigger to lower

```




```{r 4_d}
passengers %>% mutate(FamSize = Parch + SibSp)

#this code add new column name FamSize and calculate value to Parch  and SibSp addition

```

```{r 4_e}
passengers %>% group_by(Sex) %>% summarise(meanFare = mean(Fare), numSurv = sum(Survived))
#This Code goroup data by Sex attribute and gets sumary of Fare and Survu=ived and [ut them in new column meanFare numSurv

```
